summary: Email correspondence between attorney Gloria Allred and a federal prosecutor regarding scheduling a meeting for one of Allred's clients, an Epstein victim, to meet with federal authorities in New York on August 19, 2019. The client initially agrees but later decides not to meet.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Attorney communicating with a federal prosecutor to arrange a meeting for her client, an Epstein victim, with federal authorities.

persons.name: Diane Aldrich
persons.context: Assistant to Gloria Allred; the federal agent handling travel is instructed to contact her to arrange travel details for Allred's client.

connections.description: Diane Aldrich is Gloria Allred's assistant, as indicated in the email signature and instructions for travel arrangements.
Attorney-prosecutor communication regarding scheduling a meeting for a victim witness in the Epstein case.

events.title: Scheduled Meeting with Epstein Victim
events.description: A meeting was scheduled for August 19, 2019, in the afternoon at the federal prosecutor's office in New York for Gloria Allred's client, an Epstein victim, to meet with federal authorities.

keyFacts: Attorney Gloria Allred was arranging for one of her clients, an Epstein victim, to meet with federal prosecutors in New York in August 2019.
The victim initially agreed to fly from Los Angeles to New York for the meeting on August 19th but later decided not to meet.
The correspondence involves the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, indicating federal investigation activity post-Epstein's arrest.
The emails show the logistical coordination (travel, driver's license verification) involved in bringing victims forward to meet with authorities.
The document is marked as confidential and contains legally privileged information, highlighting the sensitive nature of victim communications.
